question: The first and most important function of management is ________.
Planning involves thinking ahead and deciding what needs to be done, how it should be done, and ________.
To start a restaurant, you need to plan the type of food, location, investment, and ________.
A school principal plans the academic year by deciding the ________ for each class.
Organizing means arranging everything in a systematic way so that work can be done ________.
In a restaurant, organizing includes assigning chefs to cook food, hiring waiters to serve customers, and setting up the kitchen with proper ________.
Leading (or Directing) means guiding and motivating employees to work ________.
A restaurant manager must guide the chefs to maintain food quality, motivate waiters to provide good service, and solve customer complaints ________.
Staffing involves hiring the right people for the right jobs and ensuring they work ________.
In a restaurant, staffing includes hiring skilled chefs and waiters, providing training to improve service, and ensuring workers get proper ________.
Controlling ensures that everything goes as planned. If mistakes happen, corrective actions should be taken ________.
In a restaurant, controlling includes checking if food quality is maintained, ensuring customers receive timely service, and monitoring expenses to avoid ________.
The five functions of management—Planning, Organizing, Leading, Staffing, and Controlling—help organizations run ________.
Planning is the first and most important function of management because it involves setting ________.
To start a restaurant, you need to plan the type of food, location, investment, and ________.
